data.title: Cousin Brucie concert with Herman’s Hermits in Holmdel postponed due to smoke
data.meta_description: Free show had been scheduled for PNC Bank Arts Center.
data.text:
3.1K

Veteran DJ Bruce “Cousin Brucie” Morrow had been planning to present a free June 8 concert at the PNC Bank Arts Center in Holmdel with Herman’s Hermits (starring Peter Noone), Tommy Roe and The Soundtrack of Our Lives. But the show has been postponed because of dangerous air conditions due to the Canadian wildfires.

Morrow has posted on Facebook: “URGENT BULLETIN !! THE PNC SHOW FOR 6/8/23 HAS BEEN CANCELLED-Due to the Smoke Situation. Please call any of your friends who were coming to the Show. It will be Rescheduled. We are all disappointed, however, it’s truly safer for all of us.”

(JUNE 10 UPDATE: The new date has been announced. It is July 13, with Jay Siegel’s Tokens and The Soundtrack of Our lives opening.)

The information also may be posted on the website of the Garden State Arts Foundation, which is presenting the concert.

The forecast is for air conditions in New Jersey to remain dangerous on June 8 before improving on June 9 and 10.
